etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Thomas Huxley (1825–1895), biologist and science educationist. From meso- + -podium

definitions: The middle lobe of the foot of a mollusc.
Originally; the region of a leaf primordium corresponding to the petiole; the petiole itself. Later also: an internode between prophylls in certain compound inflorescences.
The section of a tetrapod limb (especially of an amphibian or reptile) constituted by the carpus (in the forelimb) or the tarsus (in the hind limb); the mesopodial bones collectively.
